channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Why Trump's deployment of the National Guard to LA is unprecedented, according to a general
item.description: "They've thrown the entire playbook out," says a retired general on Trump's National Guard deployment

item.title: Massachusetts judge faces judicial board for allegedly aiding migrant 7 years ago
item.description: A Massachusetts judge is fighting to keep her job after being accused of helping a migrant evade immigration enforcement agents seven years ago. She faces a judicial conduct board on Monday.

item.title: As National Guard deploys, Democratic Rep. Nanette Barragán sees 'sign of a dictator'
item.description: Despite pushback from California Democrats, the Trump administration sent the National Guard to support Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Rep. Nanette Barragán says the move is escalating fear.

item.title: The latest on the LA protests sparked by immigration sweeps
item.description: President Trump deployed California's National Guard against the wishes of Gov. Newsom following protests sparked by immigration raids in LA. Officials accuse Trump of purposefully provoking chaos.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The latest on protests in Los Angeles sparked by immigration raids, President Trump's travel ban goes into effect Monday, some law clerks describe a toxic work culture under some federal judges.

item.title: U.S. and Chinese officials to hold trade talks in London on Monday
item.description: A team of President Trump's top aides, including the secretaries of the Treasury and Commerce departments, meet their Chinese counterparts for a fresh round of trade talks in London.

item.title: NPR brings housing-related climate solutions this week
item.description: The Los Angeles fires were a clear reminder of how climate change is increasingly affecting where we live. That's why all this week, NPR will be bringing you climate solutions related to housing.

item.title: Authorities detain migrants protected by program that offers help to victims of crime
item.description: President Trump says his deportation campaign prioritizes violent criminals. But immigration authorities are detaining migrants who thought they were protected by a program that helps crime victims.

item.title: Apple's WWDC event goes big on design, but says less on AI
item.description: The annual event for developers focused on a new 'Liquid Glass' interface for Apple products, but did little to follow up on last year's promise of a bold push into artificial intelligence.

item.title: Thousands attend Boulder Jewish Festival a week after attack that injured 15
item.description: A group raising awareness for hostages held in Gaza held its regular march in Colorado Sunday, exactly a week after an attack against its members. It coincided with the annual Boulder Jewish Festival.
